token.description: Displays <value> in DMS format.
token.axe:description: Displays the token whose token value is the one- or two-byte value at <pointer>.

token.description: Displays a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix in decimal format.
token.axe:description: Displays <value> as a positive number.

token.description: Displays a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix as a fraction simplified to its simplest terms.
token.axe:description: Displays <value> as a character.

token.description: Stores <value> into <variable>, which should be of a type compatible with <value>.
token.grammer:description: Stores a value

token.description: Defines plot 1, 2, or 3 as a box-and-whisker plot for <xlistname> and optional <freqlist>.
Used to define matrices, [ and ] are used to surround the data in a row as well as all the rows in a matrix. For example, [[0,1][2,3][4,5]] is a matrix of three rows and two columns.

Used to define matrices, [ and ] are used to surround the data in a row as well as all the rows in a matrix. For example, [[0,1][2,3][4,5]] is a matrix of three rows and two columns. At the end of a line or right before ‚Üí, the right parenthesis can be omitted.
Used to define lists, { and } surround the numbers in the list, separated by commas. For example, {0,1,2} is a three-element list.
token.axe:description: Returns the single byte the expression points to. It will be in the range 0 to 255.

token.description: Used to define lists, { and } surround the numbers in the list, separated by commas. For example, {0,1,2} is a three-element list. At the end of a line or right before ‚Üí, the right parenthesis can be omitted.
Interprets <angle> as radians.
token.axe:description: Modifies the function of many commands. See the commands for more information.

token.description: Interprets <degrees> as degrees; designates degrees in DMS format.
token.axe:description: Gets or sets the address at which <variable> is stored. If setting the address, <variable> should be a custom variable (with two or more characters in its name).

token.description: Returns 1 divided by a real or complex number, expression, or elements of a list, or a matrix inverted.
Returns <value> multiplied by itself, or elements of list <value> squared. <value> can be a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix.
Returns a matrix in which each element (row,column) is swapped with the corresponding element (column,row) of matrix <matrix>.
token.axe:description: Interprets <token> as a token value, converting it to an integer.

token.description: Returns the cube of a real or complex number, expression, list, or square matrix.
Everything inside parentheses take precedence when the line is evaluated.
The right parenthesis closes either a parenthetical expression or any command containing a left parenthesis. At the end of a line or right before ‚Üí, the right parenthesis can be omitted.
Returns a number, expression, list, or matrix rounded to <number> decimal places (less than or equal to nine).
Returns 1 if the pixel at row <row> and column <column> is on, 0 if it is off; <row> is between 0 and 62 and <column> is between 0 and 94.
token.axe:description: Returns 1 if pixel is black and 0 if pixel is white at (<x>,<y>) on the main buffer or specified buffer.
token.axe:description-r: Returns 1 if pixel is black and 0 if pixel is white at (<x>,<y>) on the back buffer.

token.description: Returns a matrix, which is matrix <valueB> appended to matrix <valueA> as new columns, or a list, which is list <valueB> concatenated to the end of list <valueA>.
token.grammer:description: Inserts <n> bytes into the variable <varname> at offset <offset>. Should not be used for lists or matrices.

token.description: Returns a matrix with row <rowA> of <matrix> swapped with row <rowB>.
Returns a matrix with row <rowA> of <matrix> added to row <rowB> and stored in <rowB>.
Returns a matrix with row <row> of <matrix> multiplied by <value> and stored in row <row>.
Returns a matrix with row <rowA> of <matrix> multiplied by <value>, added to <rowB>, and stored in <rowB>.

Returns the larger of <valueA> and <valueB>, a list containing the larger of each pair of elements in real or complex lists <valueA> and <valueB>, or the largest real or complex argument in <valueA> if <valueB> is not given.
token.axe:description: Returns the greater of the two values.

token.description: Returns the smaller of <valueA> and <valueB>, a list containing the smaller of each pair of elements in real or complex lists <valueA> and <valueB>, or the smallest real or complex argument in <valueA> if <valueB> is not given.
token.axe:description: Returns the smaller of the two values.

token.description: Returns the r-value, given rectangular coordinates <x> and <y> or a list of rectangular coordinates.
Returns the Œ∏-value, given rectangular coordinates <x> and <y> or a list of rectangular coordinates.
Returns the x-value, given polar coordinates <r> and <angle> or a list of polar coordinates.
Returns the y-value, given polar coordinates <r> and <angle> or a list of polar coordinates.
Returns the median of <list> with frequency <freqlist>.
Returns a random matrix of <rows> rows and <columns> columns.
Returns the mean of <list> with frequency <freqlist>.
Solves <expression> for <variable>, given an initial guess <guess> and lower and upper bounds in two-element list <bounds> within which the solution is sought.
Returns list created by evaluating <expression> with regard to <variable>, from <begin> to <end> by <increment> (defaulting to 1).
Returns the function integral of <expression> with respect to <variable>, between <lower> and <upper>, with specified <tolerance> (defaulting to 0.00001).
token.axe:description: Sets up the routine at <label> as an interrupt, executed at frequency <freq>, which should be an even number between 0 (fastest) and 6 (slowest).

token.description: Returns approximate numerical derivative of <expression> with respect to <variable> at <value>, with specified step size <h> (defaulting to 0.001).
Returns the value of <variable> where the local minimum of <expression> occurs, between <lower> and <upper>, with specified <tolerance> (defaulting to 0.00001).
Returns the value of <variable> where the local maximum of <expression> occurs, between <lower> and <upper>, with specified <tolerance> (defaulting to 0.00001).
Interprets <seconds> angle measurement as seconds or <text> as a string.
A comma separates arguments in a variety of situations.
This is the imaginary number (square root of negative one). It also marks the current expression as complex, regardless of the current mode setting.
token.axe:description: Adds a new line to the home screen.
token.grammer:description: Gets or sets the value of an EOS (TI-BASIC) variable.

token.description: Returns factorial of <value>.
Fits a cubic regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Fits a quartic regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
The number 8.

token.axe:description: The number.

token.description: Decimal point. It can be placed within or at either end of a sequence of digits.
Returns <value> times 10 to the <exponent>. <value> can be a number, list, or matrix.
token.axe:description: Interprets <hex> as an integer in hexadecimal notation.
token.grammer:description: Interprets <binary> as binary digits.

token.description: Returns 1 if <valueA> or <valueB> is not zero and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real numbers, expressions, or lists.
token.axe:description: Returns the bitwise OR of the lower 8 bits of the two numbers.

token.description: Returns 1 if exactly one of <valueA> and <valueB> is not zero and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real numbers, expressions, or lists.
token.axe:description: Returns the bitwise XOR of the lower 8 bits of the two numbers.

token.description: Alternative to newline (often used to separate expressions on the home screen).
Returns 1 if both <valueA> and <valueB> are not ¬Ézero and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real numbers, expressions, or lists.
token.axe:description: Returns the absolute value of <expression>.

Executes the program <name>.

token.grammer:description: Executes code at <pointer> as a subroutine.

token.description: One of the pictures a TI-Calculator can hold
A
Sum of x-values. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Sum of x-squared values. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Sample standard deviation of x-values. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Population standard deviation of x-values. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Correlation coefficient. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Regression coefficient. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Regression coefficient. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.

Regression coefficient. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Regression coefficient. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Coefficient of determination for statistics commands except QuadReg, CubicReg, and QuartReg. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Coefficient of determination for QuadReg, CubicReg, and QuartReg. This variable is updated by statistics commands and cannot be stored to directly.
Total number of payments.
Annual interest rate.
Present value.
Payment amount.
Future value.
Number of payment periods per year.
Number of compounding periods per year.
Sets radian angle mode.
Sets degree angle mode.
Sets normal display mode.
token.axe:description: Disables full speed (15 MHz) mode on calculators that support it.

token.description: Sets scientific notation display mode.
Sets engineering display mode.
Sets floating decimal mode.
Returns 1 if <valueA> is equal to <valueB> and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, lists, or matrices.
Returns 1 if <valueA> is less than <valueB> and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, or lists.
Returns 1 if <valueA> is greater than <valueB> and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, or lists.
Returns 1 if <valueA> is less than or equal to <valueB> and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, or lists.
Returns 1 if <valueA> is greater than or equal to <valueB> and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, or lists.
Returns 1 if <valueA> is not equal to <valueB> and 0 otherwise. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, lists, or matrices.
Returns <valueA> plus <valueB>, or the concatenation of two non-empty strings <valueA> and <valueB>. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, lists, matrices, or strings.
Returns <valueA> plus <valueB>. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, lists, or matrices.
Returns the last answer.
token.axe:description: Gets or sets the value of the OS's Ans variable as an integer. Throws an error if out of range.
token.grammer:description: This returns the result of the previous line of code. Note that this is updated at every newline and not at colons.

token.description: Sets fixed-decimal mode for <number> decimal places.
token.axe:description: Sets text mode <mode>, which should be a single digit. Modes 0 through 5 affect the behavior of Text: modes 0 and 1 set large font drawing off and on, modes 2 and 3 set inverse text mode off and on, and modes 4 and 5 determine whether text is drawn directly to the screen or to the buffer. Modes 6 and 7 determine whether the text drawn by Disp and Output( automatically scroll the screen. For all of these, the program should set the default mode (first listed) before quitting, as they affect operating system functions as well. Modes 8 and 9 turn lowercase input off and on.

token.description: Sets horizontal split-screen mode.
Sets full screen mode.
token.axe:description: Enables full speed (15 MHz) mode on calculators that support it. Does nothing on the plain TI-83 Plus.
token.grammer:description: Sets full speed (15 MHz) mode on calculators that support it, or <mode> speed (0 for normal, 1 for full, and 2 for toggle). Does nothing on the plain TI-83 Plus.

token.description: Sets function graphing mode.
token.grammer:description: Executes the subroutine pointed to by <pointer> to be executed independently of the rest of the code at a mostly regular interval. <counter> defaults to 128; setting it higher will cause the subroutine to execute less often.

token.description: Sets parametric graphing mode.
Sets polar graphing mode.
Sets sequence graphing mode.
Sets table to generate independent-variable values automatically.
Sets table to ask for independent-variable values.
Sets table to generate dependent-variable values automatically.
Sets table to ask for dependent-variable values.
Sets mode to graph functions sequentially.
Sets mode to graph functions simultaneously.
Sets polar graphing coordinates format.
Sets rectangular graphing coordinates format.
Turns on cursor coordinate value display.
Turns off cursor coordinate value display.
Sets connected plotting mode; resets all Y= editor graph-style settings to ‚ï≤.
Sets dot plotting mode; resets all Y= editor graph-style settings to ‚ã±.
Turns on the graph axes.
Turns off the graph axes.
Turns on grid format.
Turns off grid format.
Creates a <label> of one or two characters.
Turns off axes labels.
Sets sequence graphs to trace as webs.
Sets sequence graphs to plot with respect to time.
Sets sequence graphs to plot u(n) on the x-axis and v(n) on the y-axis.
Sets sequence graphs to plot v(n) on the x-axis and w(n) on the y-axis.
Sets sequence graphs to plot u(n) on the x-axis and w(n) on the y-axis.
Uses ‚ñ° as the mark for a plot. See the plot commands for more information.
token.axe:description: Returns the bitwise XOR of the all 16 bits of the two numbers.

token.description: Uses Ôπ¢ as the mark for a plot. See the plot commands for more information.
token.axe:description: Returns the bitwise OR of the all 16 bits of the two numbers.

token.description: Uses ¬∑ as the mark for a plot. See the plot commands for more information.
token.axe:description: Returns the bitwise AND of the all 16 bits of the two numbers.

token.description: Returns <valueA> times <valueB>. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, lists, or matrices.
Returns <valueA> divided by <valueB>. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real or complex numbers, expressions, or lists.
Displays the graph and enters trace mode.
Clears the graph screen.
token.axe:description: Erases the main buffer or specified buffer to white pixels.
token.axe:description-r: Erases the back buffer to white pixels.
token.axe:description-r-r: Erases both the front and back buffers to white pixels.
token.grammer:description: Clears a 768-byte buffer, like the graph screen. <buffer> is an optional argument and lets you define a buffer to clear. Otherwise, the default draw buffer is cleared.

token.description: Replots the functions immediately, updating the window variables to the default values (Xmin and Ymin at -10, Xmax and Ymax at 10, etc.).
Displays a graph, lets you draw a box that defines a new viewing window, and updates the window.
Magnifies the part of the graph that surrounds the cursor location.
Displays a greater portion of the graph, centered on the cursor location.
Adjusts the X or Y window settings so that each pixel represents an equal width and height in the coordinate system, and updates the viewing window.
Adjusts the viewing window so that ‚àÜX and ‚àÜY are 0.1 and Xscl and Yscl are 10.
Replots the graph using the window variables of the graph that was displayed before you executed the last ZOOM instruction.
Adjusts the viewing window so that ‚àÜX and ‚àÜY are 0.1, and displays the graph screen with the origin centered on the screen.
Redefines the viewing window so that all statistical data points are displayed.
Graphs the selected functions in a user-defined viewing window.
This token serves no purpose whatsoever.
Immediately stores the current viewing window.
Writes <values> on graph beginning at pixel (<row>,<column>), where <row> is between 0 and 57 and <column> is between 0 ¬Åand¬Å 94. If the first argument is negative one, large font is used.
token.axe:description: Moves the cursor coordinates to (<x>,<y>), or to <position>, whose high byte should be the y-position and low byte should be the x-position. <string> is then displayed at the new location.

token.description: Returns the number of permutations of <valueA> taken <valueB> at a time. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real numbers or lists.
Returns the number of combinations of <valueA> taken <valueB> at a time. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real numbers or lists.
Selects all equations or specified equations.
token.axe:description: Enables interrupts.

token.description: Deselects all equations or specified equations.
token.axe:description: Disables interrupts.

token.description: Stores contents on the graph in picture variable Pic<number>.
token.axe:description: Copies the main buffer to the back buffer.

token.description: Displays the graph and adds the picture stored in picture variable Pic<number>.
token.axe:description: Copies the back buffer or <buffer2> to the main buffer or <buffer1>, optionally drawing the original main buffer or <buffer1> to the screen at the same time.

token.description: Stores the current equation variables and window settings in graph database variable GDB<number>.
token.axe:description: Copies the contents of the screen to the main buffer.

token.description: Restores all equation variables and window settings stored in the graph database variable GDB<number>.
Draws a line from (<x1>,<y1>) to (<x2>,<y2>). If <number> is provided and zero, the function erases the line instead.
token.axe:description: Draws a black line from point (<x1>,<y1>) to (<x2>,<y2>) on the main buffer or specified buffer.
token.axe:description-r: Draws a black line from point (<x1>,<y1>) to (<x2>,<y2>) on the back buffer.
token.grammer:description: Draws a rectangle at (<x>,<y>) of a given <width> and <height> on buffer <buffer> using mode <mode> (0 for white, 1 for black, 2 for invert, 3 for a black border, 4 for a white border, 5 for an invert border, 6 for white with a black border, 7 for invert with a black border, 8 for black with a white border, 9 for invert with a white border, 10 for shifting the contents up, 11 for shifting the contents down, 14 for returning the number of pixels turned on in the region, and 15 for returning the number of pixels turned on in the perimeter).
token.grammer:description-l: Draws a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2) using a given method (0=white, 1=black (default), 2=invert)

token.description: Draws a vertical line at <x>.
token.axe:description: Shifts the main buffer or specified buffer down or up by one pixel. The row at the lagging edge is preserved.
token.axe:description-r: Shifts the back buffer down or up by one pixel. The row at the lagging edge is preserved.

token.description: Draws a point at (<x>,<y>) using mark <mark>.
token.axe:description: The 8-by-8 sprite pointed to is drawn at (<x>,<y>) to the main buffer or specified buffer. Does not clear the area behind it.
token.axe:description-r: The 8-by-8 sprite pointed to is drawn at (<x>,<y>) to the back buffer. Does not clear the area behind it.

token.description: Erases a point at (<x>,<y>) using mark <mark>.
token.axe:description: The 8-by-8 sprite pointed to is drawn at (<x>,<y>) to the main buffer or specified buffer, but clears the area behind it first.
token.axe:description-r: The 8-by-8 sprite pointed to is drawn at (<x>,<y>) to the back buffer, but clears the area behind it first.

token.description: Reverses a point at (<x>,<y>).
token.axe:description: The 8-by-8 sprite pointed to inverts its pixels at (<x>,<y>) to the main buffer specified buffer. Does not clear the area behind it.
token.axe:description-r: The 8-by-8 sprite pointed to inverts its pixels at (<x>,<y>) to the back buffer. Does not clear the area behind it.

token.description: Draws pixel at row <row> and column <column>; <row> is between 0 and 62 and <column> is between 0 and 94.
token.axe:description: The pixel at (<x>,<y>) becomes black on the main buffer or specified buffer.
token.axe:description-r: The pixel at (<x>,<y>) becomes black on the back buffer.

token.description: Erases pixel at row <row> and column <column>; <row> is between 0 and 62 and <column> is between 0 and 94.
token.axe:description: The pixel at (<x>,<y>) becomes white on the main buffer or specified buffer.
token.axe:description-r: The pixel at (<x>,<y>) becomes white on the back buffer.

token.description: Reverses pixel at row <row> and column <column>; <row> is between 0 and 62 and <column> is between 0 and 94.
token.axe:description: The pixel at (<x>,<y>) inverts color on the main buffer or specified buffer.
token.axe:description-r: The pixel at (<x>,<y>) inverts color on the back buffer.
token.grammer:description: Toggles a pixel at (<y>,<x>). This returns the previous state of the pixel (0=off, 1=on).

token.description: Draws <lowerfunc> and <upperfunc> in terms of X on the current graph and uses <pattern> and <patres> to shade the area bounded by <lowerfunc>, <upperfunc>, <xleft>, and <xright>.
token.axe:description: If <contrast> is provided, sets the display contrast to <contrast>, which should be between 0 and 63. If not, returns the original contrast of the display before the program was executed.

token.description: Draws a circle with center (<x>,<y>) and radius <radius>. If <list> is provided, it should be a complex list, and will enable fast circle drawing.
token.axe:description: Draws a circle with center (<x>,<y>) and <radius> on the main buffer or specified buffer.
token.axe:description-r: Draws a circle with center (<x>,<y>) and <radius> on the back buffer
token.grammer:description: Draws a circle with center (<x>,<y>) and radius <radius> on buffer <buffer> using <mode> (0 for black, 1 for white, and 2 for invert). If <pattern> is provided, it should be a one-byte (eight-bit) number where each 0 bit signifies that a pixel should be drawn, defaulting to 0.

token.description: Draws a horizontal line at <y>.
token.axe:description: Shifts the main buffer or specified buffer right or left by one pixel. White pixels are shifted in.
token.axe:description-r: Shifts the back buffer right or left by one pixel. White pixels are shifted in.
token.grammer:description: Draws a horizontal line at <y> on buffer <buffer> using <mode> (0 for black, 1 for white, and 2 for invert).

token.description: Draws a line tangent to function <expression> at x-value <value>.
token.axe:description: Draws a bitmap to (<x>,<y>) on the main buffer or specified buffer. The bitmap data should have, in order, height (1 byte), then width (1 byte), then the rows of the image zero-padded to the nearest byte. Uses Pt-On(-logic if <mode> is 0 or unspecified and Pt-Change( logic if <mode> is 1.
token.axe:description-r: Draws a bitmap to (<x>,<y>) on the back buffer. The bitmap data should have, in order, height (1 byte), then width (1 byte), then the rows of the image zero-padded to the nearest byte. Uses Pt-On(-logic.
token.axe:time: Treat as 0 cycles (actual time is time for writing to buffer)

token.description: Draws the inverse of <expression> by plotting x-values on the y-axis and y-values on the x-axis.
token.axe:description: The pixels on the main buffer or specified buffer are inverted.
token.axe:description-r: The pixels on the back buffer are inverted.

token.description: Draws <expression> (in terms of X) on the graph.
token.axe:description: The string that is pointed to is displayed at the cursor position. The cursor moves with the string. See Fix for options.

token.description: String number 1.
String number 2.
String number 3.
String number 4.
String number 5.
String number 6.
String number 7.
String number 8.
String number 9.
String number 0.
Returns a random number between 0 and 1 for a specified number of trials <numtrials>.
token.axe:description: Returns a random 16-bit number.

token.description: Return the number pi.
token.axe:description: Interprets <binary> as an integer in binary notation.
token.grammer:description: Interprets <hex> as hexadecimal digits.

token.description: Returns the key code for the current keystroke, or 0, if no key is pressed. See http://clrhome.org/keypad/ for a list of keys and their keypress values.
token.axe:description: If <keynum> is provided, returns 1 if the key is held down or 0 if not. Otherwise, returns the key code for the current keystroke, or 0, if no key is pressed. See http://clrhome.org/keypad/ for a list of keys and their keypress values.
token.axe:description-r: Waits for the user to press a sequence of keys, including modifier keys such as (2nd) and (ALPHA).
token.axe:size: getKey: 7 getKey ≥: 6 getKeys: 3 getKey(KEY): 3 getKey(0): 5 getKey(41): 9
token.grammer:description: Returns the key code for the current keystroke, or 0, if no key is pressed. If <keycode> is provided, returns 1 if that key is held down and 0 otherwise. See http://clrhome.org/resources/keypad/ for a list of keys and their keypress values.

token.description: Interprets <minutes> angle measurement as minutes.
Has no function whatsoever, but can be used in a string.
Returns the negative of a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix.
Returns the largest integer ¬Åless than or equal to a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix.
token.axe:description: Returns the value pointed to as a signed byte ranging from -128 to 127.
token.grammer:description: Stores <value> to a pointer in RAM.

token.description: Returns the absolute value of a number, expression, list, or matrix.
token.axe:description: Returns the absolute value of <expression>.

token.description: Returns determinant of <matrix>.
token.axe:description: Creates a buffer that is <size> bytes large, filled with the byte <const> or with zero if unspecified.
token.axe:size: Treat as 0 bytes, but is really <size> large

token.description: Returns the identity matrix of <dimension> rows by <dimension> columns.
token.axe:description: The compiler replaces the default icon of the executable when compiling for MirageOS or DoorsCS with the icon in <hex>, which should be 64 characters long.

token.description: Returns or assigns the dimension of <listname> or <matrixname>. For a matrix, <dimensions> should be a two-element list whose first element is the number of rows and whose second element is the number of columns.
Returns the sum of the elements of <list> (between elements <int1> and <int2>, counting from 1, if given).
Returns product of <list> elements between <start> and <end>.
Returns 1 if <value> is zero and 0 if not. <value> can be a real number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Returns the bitwise complement (one's complement) of the lower eight bits of <value>.
token.axe:description-r: Returns the bitwise complement (one's complement) of all sixteen bits of <value>.

token.description: Returns the integer part <value>.
token.axe:description: Gets or sets the <index> nibble in RAM. Since there are two nibbles in a byte, <index> should be twice as large as a pointer to the location.
token.axe:description-r: Returns the value of the <index> nibble in the flash page of the executable when compiled as an application. Since there are two nibbles in a byte, <index> should be twice as large as a pointer to the location.
token.grammer:description: Stores a two-byte little-endian value <value> to a pointer in RAM.

token.description: Returns the fractional part or parts of a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix.
token.axe:description: Gets or sets the nine-byte value starting at <pointer> as a floating-point number, into or from an integer.

token.description: Computes the sum of the present values for cash inflows and outflows.

Computes the balance at for an amortization schedule using stored values for PV, I%, and PMT and rounds the computation to
.
Computes the sum, rounded to <roundvalue>, of the principal amount between <pmt1> and <pmt2> for an amortization schedule.
Computes the sum, rounded to <roundvalue>, of the interest amount between <pmt1> and <pmt2> for an amortization schedule.
Computes the nominal interest rate.
Computes the effective interest rate.
Calculates the number of days between <dateA> and <dateB> using the actual-day-count method.
Returns the least common multiple of <valueA> and <valueB>, which can be real numbers or lists.
Returns the greatest common divisor of <valueA> and <valueB>, which can be real numbers or lists.
Returns a random integer within a range specified by <lower> and <upper> integer bounds for a specified number of trials <numtrials>.
Returns a random real number from a specified Binomial distribution for the specified number of simulations <numsimulations>.
Returns a string that is a subset of another string <string>, from <begin> (counting from 1) to <length> or <number> divided by 100.
Returns the standard deviation of the elements in <list> with frequency <freqlist>.
Returns the variance of the elements in <list> with frequency <freqlist>.
Returns the character position in <string> of the first character of <substring> beginning at <start> (defaulting to 1), or 0, if <substring> is not found in <string>
token.axe:description: Returns the character position in <string> of the byte <value> (counting from 1), or 0, if <value> is not found in <string>.
token.grammer:description: Duble-click to edit

token.description: Computes the normal distribution probability between <lowerbound> and <upperbound> for the specified mean <Œº> and standard deviation <œÉ> (defaulting to 0 and 1, respectively).
Returns the integer part of a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix.
Computes the Student's t distribution probability between <lowerbound> and <upperbound> for the specified degrees of freedom <df>.
Computes the œá¬≤ distribution probability between <lowerbound> and <upperbound> for the specified degrees of freedom <df>.
Computes the F distribution probability between <lowerbound> and <upperbound> for the specified <numeratordf> (degrees of freedom) and <denominatordf>.

Computes a probability at for the discrete binomial distribution with the specified and probability

of success on each trial.

Computes a cumulative probability at for the discrete binomial distribution with the specified and probability

of success on each trial.
Computes a probability at <x> for the discrete Poisson distribution with the specified mean <Œº>.
Computes a cumulative probability at <x> for the discrete Poisson distribution with specified mean <Œº>.

Computes a probability at , the number of the trial on which the first success occurs, for the discrete geometric distribution with the specified probability of success

.

Computes a cumulative probability at , the number of the trial on which the first success occurs, for the discrete geometric distribution with the specified probability of success

.
Computes the probability density function for the normal distribution at a specified x-value <x> for the specified mean <Œº> and standard deviation <œÉ> (defaulting to 0 and 1, respectively).
Computes the probability density function (pdf) for the Student's t distribution at a specified x-value <x> with specified degrees of freedom <df>.
Computes the probability density function (pdf) for the œá¬≤ distribution at a specified <x> value for the specified degrees of freedom <df>.
Computes the probability density function (pdf) for the F distribution at a specified <x> value for the specified <numeratordf> (degrees of freedom) and <denominatordf>.
Returns a random real number from a specified Normal distribution specified by mean <Œº> and standard deviation <œÉ> for a specified number of trials <numtrials>.
Computes the amount of each payment.
Computes the annual interest rate.
Computes the present value.
Computes the number of payment periods.
Computes the future value.
Returns the complex conjugate of a complex number or list of complex numbers.
token.axe:description: <size> (defaulting to 768) bytes starting at <pointer1> are copied to <pointer2> (defaulting to L‚ÇÜ) onwards.
token.axe:description-r: <size> bytes ending at <pointer1> are copied to <pointer2> moving backwards.

token.description: Returns the real part of a complex number or list of complex numbers.
Returns the imaginary (nonreal) part of a complex number or list of complex numbers.
Returns the polar angle of a complex number or list of complex numbers.
Returns a list of the cumulative sums of elements in list <value>, starting from the first element, or a matrix of the cumulative sums of matrix <value> elements, from top to bottom.
Converts <string> to an expression and executes it.
token.axe:description: <size> bytes starting at <pointer1> are exchanged with <size> bytes starting at <pointer2>.

token.description: Returns the number of characters in <string>.
Returns a list containing the differences between consecutive elements in <list>.
Returns the row-echelon form of a matrix <matrix>.
Returns the reduced row-echelon form of a matrix <matrix>.
Displays <value> in rectangular format.
Displays complex <value> in polar format.

Attempts <iterations> times (defaulting to 3) to fit a sinusoidal regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) using period guess <period>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Fits a logistic regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Performs a linear regression and a Student's t-test. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero.
Draws the normal density function specified by mean <Œº> and standard deviation <œÉ> (defaulting to 0 and 1, respectively) and shades the area between <lowerbound> and <upperbound>.
Draws the density function for the Student's t distribution specified by degrees of freedom <df>, and shades the area between <lowerbound> and <upperbound>.
Draws the density function for the œá¬≤ distribution specified by degrees of freedom <df> and shades the area between <lowerbound> and <upperbound>.
Draws the density function for the F distribution specified by <numeratordf> (degrees of freedom) and <denominatordf> and shades the area between <lowerbound> and <upperbound>.
Fills a <listname> with elements from a specified column <columnnumber> in <matrix> or each <listname> with elements from each column in <matrix>.
Fills <matrixname> column by column with the elements from each specified <listname>.

Performs a Student's t-test with frequency <freqlist>. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated. <listname> defaults to L‚ÇÅ.

Performs a Student's t-test with frequency <freqlist>. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated. <listname> defaults to L‚ÇÅ.

Computes a two-sample z-test. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated. <listname1> and <listname2> default to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively.

Computes a one-proportion z-test. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated.

Computes a two-proportion z-test. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated.
Performs a chi-square test. <drawflag>=1 draws results. <drawflag>=0 calculates results.
Computes a z confidence interval.
Computes a two-sample z confidence interval. <listname1> and <listname2> default to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively, and <confidence> defaults to 95.
Computes a one-proportion z confidence interval. <confidence> defaults to 95.
Computes a two-proportion z confidence interval. <confidence> defaults to 95.
Sets graph style <graphstylenumber> for function <functionnumber>.

Computes a two-sample Student's t-test. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <pooled> is not zero, variances are pooled. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated. <listname1> and <listname2> default to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively.

Computes a two-sample F test. Test is left-tailed if <alternative> is negative, right-tailed if <alternative> is positive, and two-tailed if <alternative is zero. If <drawflag> is not zero, results are drawn rather than calculated. <listname1> and <listname2> default to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively.
Computes a t confidence interval. <listname> defaults to L‚ÇÅ and <confidence> defaults to 95.
Computes a two-sample t confidence interval. If <pooled> is not zero, variances are pooled. <listname1> and <listname2> default to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively, and <confidence> defaults to 95.

Removes all list names from the stat list editor, then sets it up to display one or more <listnames> in the specified order, starting in column 1, or restores list names L‚ÇÅ through L‚ÇÜ to columns 1 through 6 if no <listnames> are provided.
Specifies an annuity due, where payments occur at the end of each payment period.
Specifies an annuity due, where payments occur at the beginning of each payment period.
Sets mode to display complex results only when you enter complex numbers.
Sets the mode to polar complex number mode (re^Œ∏ùëñ).
Sets the mode to rectangular complex number mode (a+bi).
Turns on the expression display during TRACE.
Turns off the expression display during TRACE.

Sets to 0 the dimension of all lists in
memory.
Gets contents of <variable> on a linked calculator and stores it to <variable> on the receiving calculator.
Deletes from memory the contents of <variable>.
Converts the contents of <equationname> to a string and stores it in <stringname>).
Converts the contents of <stringname> to an equation and stores it in <equationname>).
Clears the contents of the Last Entry storage area.
Selects one or more specific data points from a scatter plot or xyLine plot (only), and then stores the selected data points to two new lists, <xlistname> and <ylistname>.
Performs a one-way analysis of variance for comparing the means of two to 20 populations.
Defines plot 1, 2, or 3 as a box-and-whisker plot with outliers for <xlistname> and optional <freqlist> using mark <mark>.
Defines plot 1, 2, or 3 as a normal probability plot for <datalistname> as <axis> (either X or Y) using mark <mark>.
Sets graph-table vertical split-screen mode.
Recalculates Ymin and Ymax to include the minimum and maximum Y values, between Xmin and Xmax, of the selected functions and replots the functions.
Sets diagnostics-on mode; r, r¬≤, and R¬≤ are displayed as regression model results.
Sets diagnostics-off mode; r, r¬≤, and R¬≤ are not displayed as regression model results.
Moves the specified variables from RAM to the user data archive memory. Some variables can never be archived.
Moves the specified variables from the user data archive memory to RAM. Some variables can never be unarchived.
Executes an assembly language program.
token.axe:description: Native assembly code written in hexadecimal is inserted at the current position.

token.description: Compiles an assembly language program written in ASCII and stores the hex version.
token.axe:description: The Axiom assembly library becomes usable in the program. No quotes needed; just type the name of the appvar case sensitive.

token.description: Must be used as the first line of an assembly language program.
Displays the garbage collection menu to allow cleanup of unused archive memory.
Returns square root of a real or complex number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Returns square root of a number.

token.description: Returns the cube root of a real or complex number, expression, or list.
Returns the natural logarithm of a real or complex number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Returns logarithm base two of <value>.
token.grammer:description: Jumps <number> lines forward or backward.

token.description: Returns e raised to power <value> or a list of e raised to a list <value> of powers.
token.axe:description: Returns 2 raised to the <value> power.

token.description: Returns logarithm of a real or complex number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Creates an anonymous subroutine accepting arguments in r‚ÇÅ through r‚ÇÜ and returns its address.

token.description: Returns 10 raised to the <value> power. <value> can be a real or complex number expression, or list.
Returns the sine of a real number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Returns the sine of the number. One period is 256 and the value returned ranges from -127 to 127.

token.description: Returns the arcsine of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns cosine of a real number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Returns the cosine of the number. One period is 256 and the value returned ranges from -127 to 127.

token.description: Returns arccosine of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns the tangent of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns the arctangent of a real number, expression, or list.
token.axe:description: Returns the angle of a path that moves <dx> right and <dy> up. One period is 256 and both <dx> and <dy> range from -512 to 512.

token.description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns the hyperbolic arcsine of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns hyperbolic cosine of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns hyperbolic arccosine of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns hyperbolic tangent of a real number, expression, or list.
Returns the hyperbolic arctangent of a real number, expression, or list.
Executes <command> or <commandsA> if <condition> is met and <commandsB> if <condition> is not met.
token.axe:description: Executes <commandsA> if <condition> is met and <commandsB> if <condition> is not met.

token.description: Executes <commandsA> if <condition> is met and <commandsB> if <condition> is not met.
Executes <commandsA> if <condition> is met and <commandsB> if <condition> is not met.
token.axe:description: Executes <commandsA> if <condition> is met and <commandsB> if <condition> is not met.

token.description: Executes <commands> while <condition> is true. <condition> is checked at the beginning.
token.axe:description: Executes <commands> while <condition> is true. <condition> is checked at the beginning.

token.description: Executes <commands> until <condition> is true. <condition> is checked at the end; that is, <commands> will be executed at least once.
token.axe:description: Executes <commands> until <condition> is true. <condition> is checked at the beginning.

token.description: Executes <commands>, incrementing <variable> from <begin> by <increment> (defaulting to 1) until <variable> is greater than <end>.
token.axe:description: Executes <commands>, incrementing <variable> from <begin> by 1 until <variable> is greater than <end>, or <iterations> times in total. If one argument is provided, Goto cannot be used within <commands>.
token.grammer:description: Executes <commands>, incrementing <variable> from <begin> by 1 until <variable> is greater than <end>, or <iterations> times in total. If one argument is provided, Goto cannot be used within <commands>.

token.description: Identifies end of For(, If-Then-Else, Repeat, or While loop.
token.axe:description: Identifies end of For(, If-Then-Else, Repeat, or While loop. An If condition can be provided to exit a While or Repeat loop only if <condition> is met.
token.grammer:description: Identifies end of For(, If-Then-Else, Repeat, or While loop.

token.description: Returns to the calling program or to the home screen if none.
token.axe:description: Returns from the current subroutine or program, optionally with a value. If <condition> is provided, returns only if it is true.

token.description: Creates a <label> of one or two characters.
token.axe:description: Creates a <label> of one to thirteen characters.
token.grammer:description: Returns a pointer to the label called string <label> in <varname> or the current program.

token.description: Transfers control to <label>.
token.axe:description: Transfers control to <label>.
token.grammer:description: Transfers control to <pointer>.

token.description: Displays <value> if provided; suspends program execution until you press (ENTER).
token.axe:description: Pauses execution for <time>, in the order of milliseconds.
token.grammer:description: Suspends program execution for <time> centiseconds or while <expression> is true.

token.description: Ends program execution; returns to home screen.
token.axe:description: Pauses execution until the next interrupt occurs. Interrupts must be on or else the calculator will freeze.

token.description: Increments <variable> by one, and skips the next line if the result is greater than <value>.
token.grammer:description: Reads the byte pointed to by the pointer <variable>, then increments <variable>.

token.description: Decrements <variable> by 1; skips the next line if <variable> is less than <value>.
token.axe:description: Decrements <variable> by 1; if variable is zero, executes <commands> and resets <variable> to <value>.

token.description: When given no arguments, displays the graph screen is displayed and waits for the user to select a point with the cursor, storing coordinates in X and Y; when arguments are given, prompts for value to store to <variable>, displaying <text> if it is given and "?" otherwise.
token.axe:description: Prompts for a string and returns a pointer to it (as tokens, not characters).
token.grammer:description: Prompts for a string from the user, starting at the end of the current text coordinates, and returns a pointer to the string. <suffix> is kept displayed at the end of the input string, if given.

token.description: Prompts for value for <variable1>, then <variable2>, and so on.
Displays the home screen and each value provided.
token.axe:description: The string that is pointed to is displayed at the cursor position. The cursor moves with the string. If it reaches the end of the screen, it will loop around to the next line.
token.grammer:description: Defines contrast level or default primary buffer, or default secondary buffer, respectively.

token.description: Displays the graph.
token.axe:description: Draws the main buffer or specified buffer to the screen.
token.axe:description-r: Draws the specified buffers to the screen for three-level grayscale. <bufferA> and <bufferB> default to the main and back buffers, respectively.
token.axe:description-r-r: Draws the specified buffers to the screen for four-level grayscale. <bufferA> and <bufferB> default to the main and back buffers, respectively.
token.grammer:description: Draws the contents of the screen to the LCD, updating one gray cycle. The optional argument allows you to update a different buffer, other than the default.

token.description: Displays <value> beginning at specified <row> and <column>.
token.axe:description: Moves the cursor coordinates to (<column>,<row>), counting from 0, or to <position>, whose high byte should be column and low byte should be row. <string> is then displayed at the new location.
token.grammer:description: Sets the text writing mode. 0 is the standard 4x6 font; 1 is a variable-width font; 2 is the 4x6 font using pixel coordinates instead of a character map; 3 is an Omnicalc-format font. <font> points to a custom font.

token.description: Clears the home screen.
token.axe:description: Erases the screen and text shadow and moves the cursor to the upper left corner.
token.grammer:description: Resets the homescreen cursor and clears the homescreen.

token.description: Stores <value> to each element in matrix or list <name>.
token.axe:description: Fills <size> bytes after <pointer> with the byte at <pointer>, or fills <size> bytes starting at <pointer> with byte <value>. If <value> is provided, <size> must be greater than 1; if not, it must be greater than 0.

token.description: Sorts elements of <keylistname> in ascending order, then sorts each <dependlist> as a dependent list using elements in <keylistname> as keys.
Sorts elements of <keylistname> in descending order, then sorts each <dependlist> as a dependent list using elements in <keylistname> as keys.
token.axe:description: Sorts up to 256 bytes of data from largest to smallest starting at the pointed address.

token.description: Displays the table.
Generates a menu of up to seven items during program execution.
token.grammer:description: Draws a menu at (<x>,<y>) with width <width> and returns the number of the item selected, counting from 0.

token.description: Sends contents of <variable> to the CBL 2/CBL or CBR System.
token.axe:description: Attempts for <time>, in the order of microseconds to send <value> as a byte to a linked calculator; stops upon successful reception or timeout.

token.description: Gets data from the CBL 2/CBL or CBR and stores it in <variable>.
token.axe:description: Returns the byte sent by the linked calculator or -1 if no byte was sent. Does not wait.
token.grammer:description: Returns a pointer to variable <varname> and stores the flash page it's on to Œ∏' (0 if in RAM).

token.description: Selects all stat plots or one or more specified stat plots (1, 2, or 3).
Turns off all plots or specifically the ones listed in <data> (which should be a sequence of numbers between 0 and 3, separated by commas).
Returns the list named <name>.
token.axe:description: Returns the address of the label <label>.
token.grammer:description: This will execute a given line starting at the beginning of the program. <start> is an optional argument to give it a different start address (like a label, for example), <size> is the size of the search field (defaulting to 0, or 65536) and is useful to make sure it doesn't execute code outside the program, and <delim> is the char code of the line delimiter used (defaulting to newline).

token.description: Defines a plot in Plot1. See Scatter, xyLine, Histogram, ModBoxPlot, BoxPlot, or NormProbPlot for information on the arguments in <data>.
token.axe:description: The two consecutive 8-by-8 sprites are drawn to the main buffer and back buffer, respectively. Bits clear on both sprites are ignored (transparent); the other three combinations are black, gray, and white.
token.axe:description-r: The two consecutive 8-by-8 sprites are drawn to the main buffer or specified buffer. Bits clear on both sprites are ignored (transparent); the other three combinations are black, white, and inverted.

token.description: Defines a plot in Plot2. See Scatter, xyLine, Histogram, ModBoxPlot, BoxPlot, or NormProbPlot for information on the arguments in <data>.
token.axe:description: Creates a temporary copy of the 8-by-8 sprite at (<x>,<y>) on the main buffer or specified buffer and returns a pointer to it, or copies a temporary copy of it to <temp>.
token.axe:description-r: Creates a temporary copy of the 8-by-8 sprite at (<x>,<y>) on the back buffer and returns a pointer to it.

token.description: Defines a plot in Plot3. See Scatter, xyLine, Histogram, ModBoxPlot, BoxPlot, or NormProbPlot for information on the arguments in <data>.
Returns <value> raised to <power>, or elements in list or matrix <value> raised to <power>. <value> can be a real or complex number, expression, list, or matrix.
Returns root <valueA> of <valueB>. <valueA> and <valueB> can be real numbers or lists.
Performs one-variable analysis on the data in <xlistname> with frequency <freqlist>.
Performs two-variable analysis on the data in <xlistname> and <ylistname> with frequency <freqlist>.
Fits a linear regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Fits an exponential regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Fits a logarithmic regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
token.axe:description: Returns the calculator to normal interrupt mode; should be called before quitting if the program uses custom interrupts.

token.description: Fits a power regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Fits a median-median model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Fits a quadratic regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
Sets to 0 the dimension of one or more <listnames>.
Clears all values from the table.
token.axe:description: Gets or sets the status of the link port as a two-bit number. If the status is changed, the program should set it back to zero before quitting.

token.description: Defines plot 1, 2, or 3 as a histogram for <xlistname> and optional <freqlist>.
Defines plot 1, 2, or 3 as a connected scatter plot for <xlistname> and <ylistname> using mark <mark>.
Defines plot 1, 2, or 3 as a scatter plot for <xlistname> and <ylistname> using mark <mark>.
Fits a linear regression model to <xlistname> and <ylistname> (defaulting to L‚ÇÅ and L‚ÇÇ, respectively) with frequency <freqlist>, and stores the regression equation to <regequ>.
